properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 9 at 1:59PM PST until February 9 at 3:45PM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in OXNARD has issued a

* Urban and Small Stream Flood Advisory for...
East central Los Angeles County in southwestern California...

* Until 345 PM PST.

* This flood advisory replaces the previous flood advisory issued at
1255 pm, expanding the areal coverage across east central Los Angeles
County. At 147 PM PST, Doppler radar continued to indicate areas of
moderate to locally heavy showers extending along the Interstate 210
corridor from Monrovia to Pasadena and Glendale, as well as Hollywood
to Beverly Hills. There have been several reports of roadway flooding
across portions of the Los Angeles basin, especially near the foothills.

* Isolated thunderstorms are still possible across this region, potentially
bringing brief heavy downpours, small hail, and gusty winds. Rainfall
rates will generally range between 0.25 and  0.50 inches per hour with
heavier showers, but an isolated rate to near 1.00 inch per hour will
be possible near any thunderstorms that develop.

* Some locations that could experience roadway flooding include...
Sierra Madre, Pasadena, Glendale, Altadena, Hollywood and
Beverly Hills. Major roadways that could be impacted include Interstates
5, 210, and 405 as well as Highways 2 and 134.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding
of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
